[h1]TL:DR[/h1]
[i]This is the perfect game to show someone that's interested in gaming for the first time.[/i]

[h1]The Good Stuff[/h1]
+Picks up from the original game, however you could come straight into this one but the first is best to start with for story
+One of the best puzzle games out that that's constantly innovating itself as the game progresses
+Excellent co-op experience providing so many new possibilties for fun
+Wheatley and GLaDOS are some of the best NPCs out there, providing constant humor and enjoyment to every level, for the most part its banter and insults
+The atmosphere in this game trumps that of the first as you'll find yourself in multiple areas quite diverse from each other
+The soundtrack is a blast, sometimes calming, sometimes exhilarating
+Beat the campaign? Co-op too? Try out the endless supply of community workshop maps! 
+With the innovation, you'd think the game would become harder after awhile. Although new mechanics are introduced throughout, the game itself never becomes that much harder but rather requires different approaches to situations and more lengthy puzzles
+There's basically two stories going on at one time. The main one at hand and another develops part of the way through that goes into a lot of backstory to the whole game's universe 

[h1]The Ok Stuff[/h1]
=The main campaign needs only one or two playthroughs, the characters and a couple achievements are what would bring you back for a second time
=So I love subtitles in general across all media types, bowever this game's subtitle design is rather basic and ill-timed. A lot of the subtitles are shown at 3-4 sentences at a time which usually ruins comedic timing and can give away what's about to happen in a few moments (i.e. effects, plot changes, inflection of sentence) That all being said, it is perfectly okay to play without subtitles (As 95% of people do, unlike my weird self) as the characters are very easy to understand

[h1]The Bad Stuff[/h1]
-It is slightly repetitive indeed. Best way to counter this would be to play awhile, set it down and come back later making the game into a couple play sessions which wouldn't ruin the story in any fashion

[h1]The Truthful Hard Facts[/h1]

[tr][td]Acquirement Method[/td][th]Portal Bundle @ Steam Store[/th][/tr]
[tr][td]Price Paid[/td][th]$4.99[/th][/tr]

[/table]

its...just.....eh..... dont get me wrong the campeign is the best part of the game for me, and it sort of follows the first game, however you can go into this on blind not knowing anything about the first game. now the multiplayer....ive only played it a little bit and its just all...eh....its fun with friends kinds but after awhile your friends just get bored and quit. the costom maps are fun. replay value....its not your gonna be playing this game a whole lot after the campeign. once in awhile i redownload it to play with my sister split screen but that just once in awhile. like i said its not like youll be playing the hell out of this game after the campeign so its getting a big, BIG 6/10.

As you can see, Portal 2 draws from the award-winning formula of innovative game-play, story, and music that earned the original Portal over 70 industry accolades and created a cult following. The single-player portion of Portal 2 introduces a cast of dynamic new characters, a host of fresh puzzle elements, and a much larger set of devious test chambers. Players will explore never-before-seen areas of the Aperture Science Labs and be reunited with GLaDOS, the occasionally murderous computer companion who guided them through the original game. The game’s two-player cooperative mode features its own entirely separate campaign with a unique story, test chambers, and two new player characters. This new mode forces players to reconsider everything they thought they knew about portals. Success will require them to not just act cooperatively, but to think cooperatively.

У вас IQ 200+? У вас есть отбитый однорукий друг? У вас калькулятор а не компьютер? Эта игра для вас
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Плюсы:
+Сюжет
(Он реально очень хороший,хоть и клешированный. В конце может реально пробить на сильные эмоции.)
+Геймплей
(Уровни и левелдизайн впечатляют. Они преймножили все хорошое что было в первой игре по части уровней.)
+Юмор
(Очень хороший юмор от ГЛАДОС и глупость Уитли забавляют. За юмор однозначно плюс.)
+Пользовательские уровни
(Очень сильно продливает жизнь игре и хотя бы ради них стоит купить эту игру)
+Кооп
(А вот ради чего абсолютно точно надо ее купить,так это ради коопа. Ничего про него не буду говорить,каждый должен сам попробовать.)

Минусы
-Графика
(Конечно для игры на Source весьма круто,но все же не высший уровень.)
-Русская Озвучка
(Если вы играли в оригинальной озвучке то прошу, не играйте на русской озвучке.Если не играли то можете играть на русской.)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Игра определенно стоит своих денег. Купив ее, вы получаете интересный геймплей, красиво оформленные локации (в отличии от первой части в которой локации были скучные), интересный и захватывающий сюжет, острый юмор, возможность играть с другом в кооперативе, возможность играть в пользовательские карты. Не скажу, что игра нереально сложная, просто интересная в плане сложности, догадатьсяне сложно. На прохождение одиночной кампании в общем я потратил около 10 часов. Опеределенно советую.

Really fun but 1 thing that should be done is to change the level editor to have more things to do to your level like to make your level look like it's in old Aperture or to have it broken down. Another thing I would like is to choose what soundtrack should play while playing the level because the same 5 tracks become stale after some time. ALSO it would be cool if we can have things that can be done in Hammer to be in the normal level editor. Trigers are a thing that would make alot of things WAYY better and with them we can make cool puzzles. AND if you can make like small platforms or a small hole in a wall to put a button so It doesn't need to be a meter long hole just for 1 button, because it's ugly.  What I'm trying saying is that the curent level editor could be something BETTER and with some changes it can become a reason people start playing again or even buy Portal 2!
 But anyways, it's a good game. 10/10 would replay again and again.

The primary mechanics don't really change from portal but makes real strives in changing the story to a more full experience. While its strength lies in the single player campaign, the Co-op makes new challenges to partially enjoy and fully annoy your friends.

Over 10 years later, Portal 2 is still one of the best games ever created and one that I still consider one of my all-time favourites. Portal 2 and the original Portal are an absolute must play. Intuitive, incredibly fun gameplay with a wondrous atmosphere/story and outstanding performance from the voice cast will leave you with memories you will cherish and won't be able to forget.

I found myself revisiting the Portal games several times throughout the years, and cannot put into words the amount of fun and unforgettable experiences I had, on both singleplayer and co-op.

Thank you to everyone involved in making this absolute masterpiece for the incredible experiences and joy this game has brought into my life.

Some people may love it(like me), but some people may not. if you liked to build Lego where you were young, and if you like puzzles, this game is made for you. i finished the game in 7.5h, i cannot stop. it litterally talk to my brain, giving the kind of challenges i love to solve. 
Some of my friends didnt like it. i guess they dont like puzzle...
But there is not only the game design which makes this game great.
A unique atmosphere, tons of game / science-fi references, a dark and sarcastic humor, we can really feel it was done by people who enjoyed what they are doing.
Cannot wait for a Portal 3!

I was/am a huge fan of Portal.  For me, it was so different from anything I'd played before.  The idea of a first person puzzler was so new, coupled with the portal mechanic, I couldn't get enough of the game.  I obessed over the challenge levels and serached the workshop, as well as made my own levels.  I was excited and nervous for the sequel.

Sequels can be just as good as the original and still feel much worse just because of expections.  For Portal 2, the sequel delivers.  The humor from the first is back, but stepped up to a new level.  The interaction between GLaDOS and Wheatley is just magic.  The voice actors and writers did a great job.  While the first game is a introduction to puzzle solving, this one is more like a detective story with puzzles.  As the game progresses more backstory is uncovered leading to a better understanding of both games.

Portal 2 adds new mechanics as well with gels.  The gels are fun in adding a new way to explore the game.  The only downside is that they tend to lead to intended solutions.  The game feels slightly (very slightly) more forced than the first.  While there are always designed solutions, these solutions feel more apparent with the gels.  Still a very solid puzzler and very fun.

I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a fun game to play.  If you have a friend who wants to play as well the multiplayer is great as well.  Wonderful game.

I originally played this (as well as Portal 1) on my XBox. After the Steam Sale a few months back, I got this game, and I am honestly astounded by how good it is on a PC. Only wish my specs were better to increase FPS

This game has an amazing story that kept me soooo tied to the game that I would be caught playing for hours and hours and hours and hours  on end, and I enjoyed every second of it. It legitimately depresses me that no other  game will give me the same feeling/experience  that Portal 2 has given me ever again. The entire atmosphere of this game makes you feel like you are alone & lost, with incredible views and silence in most parts of the game, which I happen to love. The Characters are Fantastic ! The gameplay  is of course, incredible. Even when I was stuck on some of the puzzles, the game managed to keep me fighting on and trying again. Valve has done a great job of using the materials they created to make new and exotic puzzles over and over again.There are also great Community made games that i also played and some of them are really nice !  If you read this review and want to see the game, please DO NOT watch any game play or get spoiled in any way whatsoever. This is an experience you want to have on your own, and one you will miss when it is over. I recommend you playing the COOP Campaign with a good friend its rly funny and still one of the best COOP games i ever played ! SO GO GET THE GAME !
игра супер

Un excellent jeu qui prolonge l'expérience dans l'univers d'Half Life. Les graphismes sont réussis et le jeu est prenant. L'humour est omniprésent et les doublages en français sont excellents. On a plaisir à suivre le fil de l'histoire et à decouvrir un petit peu plus le background de cet univers fantastique. La durée de vie est revue à la hausse par rapport à PORTAL premier du nom et de nombreux modes de jeux sont présents avec de la coopération, des challenges et même des salles conçues par la communauté. En bref un bon jeu de casse tête.
melhor jogo de puzzle , recomendo, valve ta de parabens pela essa obra prima!
This game is really fun and good.
